articles.title: Image Blending
articles.subtitle: Computational Photography Assignment 6
articles.abstract: Using convolution and Gaussian distribution, you can create a custom image-blending application.

articles.title: Room Obscura
articles.subtitle: Computational Photography Assignment 5
articles.abstract: I had always been well aware of the pinhole camera, a science project that's about as old as the Roman empire, but I had never tried it myself before. This project took this classic experiment and scaled it to turn a whole room, not a shoebox, into a primitive camera.

articles.title: Grade Calculator
articles.subtitle: Course Grade Calculator
articles.abstract: If you're in school and, like me, enjoy playing the "what-if" game with your grades, you might find this fun and/or helpful

articles.title: API Hacking
articles.subtitle: Blog/tutorial on how APIs work
articles.abstract: Application program interfaces (APIs) are protocols and specifications for how a particular software service works. When you search for your local weather forecast, for example, whatever site you use will send weather data for your location using the same query parameters, response format, and subroutines as it would for any other valid location. This blog explains how you can look at just this data to figure out how to integrate these data into other sites, apps, or feeds.

articles.title: Automated Speedtest
articles.subtitle: Personal project forked from Matt Martz's speedtest-cli
articles.abstract: Crontab + Python = . Learned a lot from this project, specifically Linux, SSH, and VCS/CI. If you've got some old hardware lying around, set up your own server to automatically test your internet connection speed even when you're not home.
